poem:
**Brazen Tour**

Amid desert whispers and golden suns,  
he strolls through opulent halls,  
where currency flows like oasis streams,  
his promises bold as camel's stride.  
Real estate glimmers with digital dust,  
in the land of whispered chants,  
the tune of coins jingles—  
brazen, yes, as dawn meeting the sand.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Seth Meyers on Trump corruption: ‘It’s all so brazen’ Late-night hosts recapped Donald Trump’s ongoing tour of the Middle East and his brazenly corrupt business deals in the region. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
